Name: Legislative jurisdiction over property
Text:
Section 7A. The governor may accept retrocession of legislative jurisdiction by the United States over lands within the commonwealth acquired by the United States for federal purposes, whenever in his opinion such retrocession is in the public interest. Notice of such acceptance shall be filed by the governor with the state secretary.

A copy of such notice shall be filed by the governor with the recorder of deeds for the county or district where such land is located.

As used in this section, the word "governor" shall include any person authorized by him to act for him in the premises.

See chapter 268, section 1A for related provisions.
